body:
The CI has been fixed.

@feng-tao Don't worry regarding CI for this specific PR as it is just a doc update. So you don't need to restart the CI.

The build passes:
https://travis-ci.org/kaxil/incubator-airflow/builds/380802183

# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3379?src=pr&el=h1) Report

> The diff coverage is `0%`.

> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3379?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [76b68b8...0d44d01](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3379?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
Oh, I mentioned a wrong issue. Thanks for the comment @sreenathkamath!
Thanks @Fokko @kaxil, rebased on master.
@kaxil @sekikn Master still looks dark red here: https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/branches
hey @kaxil , the pr passed all the tests except something related to k8s which is unrelated.
Thanks @feng-tao for doing this. I've merged it to master. I was a bit reluctant to merge this without any proper testing, just because it touches some of the core files. Cheers
@gwax can you rebase onto master?
hey @Fokko , sure, I understand your concern :) Glad that it passed all the tests. Thanks for fixing the CI :)
@feng-tao The CI is still pretty flaky :(
This makes sense to me, but I'm not actively using SLA's. Maybe another committer can look at this?
@BasPH Your tests are failing, can you rebase against master?
Hmm. According to the CI result, perhaps AIRFLOW-2441 introduced a new bug around string encoding on Python3. I'll investigate it together.

hitting a bug that can't use `lib.form_js()` in rbac ti_log.html, removing the line fixed but will trying to find out the root cause.

EDIT: Seems like it's from admin/lib.html which RBAC don't want to import. And we don't seem to need that line.
hey @kaxil , thanks for pointing it out. I have fixed the unit tests. Now let's see if the CI passes :)

#3298 Should solve one but two other undefined names remain.... flake8 testing of https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow on Python 3.6.3

$ flake8 . --count --select=E901,E999,F821,F822,F823 --show-source --statistics
```
./airflow/www/app.py:148:17: F821 undefined name 'reload'
                reload(e)
                ^
./tests/operators/hive_operator.py:178:27: F821 undefined name 'cursor_mock'
                __enter__=cursor_mock,
                          ^
./tests/operators/hive_operator.py:184:27: F821 undefined name 'get_conn_mock'
                __enter__=get_conn_mock,
                          ^
3     F821 undefined name 'reload'
3
```

@kaxil @Fokko PTAL
Hi @rodrigc. Thanks for picking this up. There won't be an Airflow 1.9.1. We're are working on Airflow 1.10 which will include the cherry-picked commits.
This cherry picked work will also be in Airflow 1.10
Nice one!

Looking at the CI, it seems to fail under Python 2.7:
```
======================================================================
45) ERROR: test_xss_prevention (tests.www.test_views.TestVariableView)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/www/test_views.py line 120 in setUp
      app = application.create_app(testing=True)
    airflow/www/app.py line 150 in create_app
      from importlib import reload
   ImportError: cannot import name reload
```
Please adhere to the commit guidelines.
LGTM now. I just saw `Flask-AppBuilder` released `v1.11.1`.  👍 ☕️

Please fix the errors:

```
======================================================================
16) ERROR: test_code (tests.www_rbac.test_views.TestAirflowBaseViews)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/www_rbac/test_views.py line 361 in test_code
      resp = self.client.get(url, follow_redirects=True)

      response = self.run_wsgi_app(environ, buffered=buffered)

      app_rv = app(environ, start_response)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1997 in __call__
      return self.wsgi_app(environ, start_response)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1985 in wsgi_app
      response = self.handle_exception(e)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1540 in handle_exception
      reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1982 in wsgi_app
      response = self.full_dispatch_request()
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1614 in full_dispatch_request
      rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1517 in handle_user_exception
      reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1612 in full_dispatch_request
      rv = self.dispatch_request()
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1598 in dispatch_request
      return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask_appbuilder/security/decorators.py line 26 in wraps
      return f(self, *args, **kwargs)
    airflow/www_rbac/views.py line 338 in code
      demo_mode=conf.getboolean('webserver', 'demo_mode'))
    airflow/www_rbac/views.py line 94 in render
      **context)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/templating.py line 134 in render_template
      context, ctx.app)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/templating.py line 116 in _render
      rv = template.render(context)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/jinja2/environment.py line 989 in render
      return self.environment.handle_exception(exc_info, True)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/jinja2/environment.py line 754 in handle_exception
      reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
    airflow/www_rbac/templates/airflow/dag_code.html line 18 in top-level template code
      {% extends "airflow/dag.html" %}

      {% import 'appbuilder/baselib.html' as baselib %}
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask_appbuilder/templates/appbuilder/init.html line 60 in top-level template code
      {% block tail %}
    airflow/www_rbac/templates/airflow/dag_code.html line 46 in block "tail"
      {{ super() }}
    airflow/www_rbac/templates/airflow/dag.html line 334 in block "tail"
      url = "{{ url_for('airflow.graph') }}" +
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/helpers.py line 333 in url_for
      return appctx.app.handle_url_build_error(error, endpoint, values)
    .tox/py27-backend_mysql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flask/app.py line 1805 in handle_url_build_error

   BuildError: Could not build url for endpoint 'airflow.graph'. Did you mean 'Airflow.graph' instead?
```

All the failing tests have the same `BuildError` as above.
Yes, there is one specific tests `dag_run_catchup` which fails randomly.

__reload()__ is a [builtin in Python 2](https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#reload) so the only way that it can be an _undefined name_ in Python 2 is if __del reload__ is being executed which I do not see in this repo’s code.

@feng-tao . Some of them are false positives:

* The `mlengine_prediction_summary` ones are using beam api operators hence using pipe for chaining which causes this false positive. 
* The `auth/backends/` does require `flask_login.login_required` & `'flask_login.logout_user'`.

The PR passed the **Flake 8** tests: 
`https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/builds/381786346`

Although if you can resolve the following lines, it would be good:

```
airflow/contrib/auth/backends/ldap_auth.py:65:5: E722 do not use bare except'
airflow/contrib/auth/backends/ldap_auth.py:97:5: E722 do not use bare except'
airflow/contrib/hooks/aws_hook.py:75:9: E722 do not use bare except'
```

That sounds like a really good idea. Would also go a long way towards
reducing run-time for tests. We'd have to figure out if offline development
is an issue though.

```[error] 0.31% tests.ImpersonationTest.test_default_impersonation: ^[[31m4.6534s^[[0m```
 Also looks like all of the impersionation tests are broken by this so should look into that.

@dimberman re: offline development, docker images are cached locally once you download them. If you know you'll be offline, you can download the image beforehand (running `docker-compose -f scripts/ci/docker-compose.yml run airflow-testing bash` once should be enough to trigger this). 

There's also a  `docker save` command to save this image to a tarfile, so that it can be imported later.

Fair point. Yeah, overall I think this is a great idea. I've had multiple python projects switch to docker based testing and it's helped a lot. Would also drastically lower the barrier for new contributors (but please clean up your commits. You can definitely squash this down a lot).

@dimberman re: impersonation tests, are you familiar with the preconditions for impersonation in general to work? These tests have been hard to debug, and I'm still not sure how to fix them. The only reason I can think of they might not be working is that I'm running the main container with the root user, instead of a regular user with superpowers.

Thanks @kaxil for picking this up. Ignoring false positives is also relatively easy in Flake8: http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/3.1.1/user/ignoring-errors.html

Please add a comment that provides the reason why the error is being ignored. This will allow us to flake8 the whole project instead of the diffs 👍
